meanings.definition: A barrier built out into a body of water to protect a coast or harbor from the force of waves.
meanings.sent1: The breakwaters shielded the harbor from the powerful waves.
meanings.sent2: The coast was safeguarded by the breakwaters from the rough sea.
meanings.sent3: The breakwaters decided to take a break and relax on the sandy shore.
meanings.sent4: The breakwaters stood strong like guardians against the relentless waves.
meanings.sent5: The breakwaters stood tall, like a wall of protection against the crashing waves.

meanings.definition: A structure built to break the force of waves, as before a harbor.
meanings.sent1: The breakwaters were constructed to weaken the force of the waves hitting the harbor.
meanings.sent2: The sailors could see the breakwaters ahead, signaling the entrance to the safe harbor.
meanings.sent3: The breakwaters decided to throw a party to celebrate their success in calming the waves.
meanings.sent4: The breakwaters acted as a shield, breaking the powerful waves before they reached the harbor.
meanings.sent5: The breakwaters were like brave warriors, battling the fierce waves to protect the harbor.
